column4: anybody got any bright ideas for testing a power supply (without having one to swap it with)
it's sudden instant-off, and then it boots back up. It does not go through the shutdown process
you should go to hardware channel, but I think you need to reconfigure your bios setup?
it worked great up until today
and we've had some moderate storms lately
I didn't know there was a hardware channel
you are talking about just one all a lot of computers?
well, one out of two in this building
what situation are you facing? tell us what happened exactly
The computer booted up today. I logged in. Shortly afterward, the screen went black, and I started to boot up again. Rinse and repeat ;-)
horrible, what gave you by unam -a?
and what is your computer type or model?
I just booted off of a liveUSB
it's a custom built machine, I don't remember the processor. 512MB of ram, dual 1TB sata's in RAID0
recovery mode seems stable, but neither this kernel nor the previous kernel are, it reboots either way.
it seems to last longer if I don't do anything than if I open firefox, etc...
